snippet: Since 1982, the prestigious journal BMJ has devoted its Christmas-week issue to publishing unusual articles that are all based on methodologically sound science.
abstract: Study to appear in Christmas-week issue of BMJ shows that blood vessels are more abundant in noses of reindeer than in humans, causing them to 'glow' under thermal imaging technology, lending credibility to Rudolph myth; journal devotes its holiday issue to publishing unusual articles that are all based on methodologically sound science.
lead_paragraph: Since 1982, the prestigious journal BMJ has devoted its Christmas-week issue to publishing unusual articles that are all based on methodologically sound science.

headline.seo: BMJ’s Holiday Tradition of Lighthearted, but Rigorous, Scholarship
headline.main: Journal Offers Dose of Fun for Holiday
